smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'ClassSelectionActivity' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'Utils.kt' with '22' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'

Class 'LearningDbView' with '19' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'Database' with '19' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

Class 'TestActivity' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'TestEngine' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function onCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (listView.adapter as SavedSelectionsAdapter) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: listView.adapter as SavedSelectionsAdapter
Parentheses in (r * (b - a)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: r * (b - a)
Parentheses in (probaParams.daysEnd * 0.99) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: probaParams.daysEnd * 0.99
Parentheses in (1 - stage0.longScore) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 1 - stage0.longScore

Parentheses in (MAX_LONG_SCORE_UPDATE_INCREMENT *
                                    min(daysSinceAsked /
                                            (probaParams.daysEnd * 0.99 * previousLongScore), 1.0)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: MAX_LONG_SCORE_UPDATE_INCREMENT *
                                    min(daysSinceAsked /
                                            (probaParams.daysEnd * 0.99 * previousLongScore), 1.0)
Parentheses in (daysEnd * 0.5) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: daysEnd * 0.5
Parentheses in (activity!! as TestFragmentHolder) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activity!! as TestFragmentHolder
Parentheses in (activity!! as TestFragmentHolder) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activity!! as TestFragmentHolder
Parentheses in (pathMeasure.length.toInt() * scale) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pathMeasure.length.toInt() * scale
Parentheses in (activity!! as TestFragmentHolder) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activity!! as TestFragmentHolder
Parentheses in (activity!! as TestFragmentHolder) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activity!! as TestFragmentHolder
Parentheses in (it.animatedValue as Int shl 24) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it.animatedValue as Int shl 24
Parentheses in (disabledCount.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: disabledCount.toFloat() / total
Parentheses in (stats.bad.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: stats.bad.toFloat() / total
Parentheses in (stats.meh.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: stats.meh.toFloat() / total
Parentheses in (stats.good.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: stats.good.toFloat() / total

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class LocaleManager only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class TypefaceManager only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.
The class UriResolver only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `ret.map { getProbabilityDataStage2(probaParams2, it) } to DebugParams(probaParams, probaParams2)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `item to reading`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `cursor.getString(0) to cursor.getString(1)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `cursor.getLong(0) to cursor.getString(1)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `it.first to it.second.filter { isKanji(it) }`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `.25f to .75f`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `.4f to .6f`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `.5f to .5f`
